messages.message: Getting a really weird bug where my Flow is just process files, and doesn’t includes a scripts directory, but for some reason is still reading my scripts directory. @shaunak?
Can help look into it. @Aaron Vontell can you give me access to that repo and the specific link so I can help debug
Note that I do expect there to be an error in scripts, because a lib I am using is not on Instabase - but I wanted to run OCR on instabase rather than locally
(going to quickly remove the scripts folder and re-run, will add it back)
Renaming my scripts folder to scriptss allowed me to bypass the issue, but that means we are hardcoding a scripts folder somewhere, which is not good
Hey @Aaron Vontell, yes the scripts/ folder is read from because that’s where post and pre-flow hooks are setup

@Justin — in Flow Lifecycle, we should address the construction and configuration of a flow. Right now since we don’t have a UI, we have to use implicit folder structures to determine where pre- post-flow hooks are setup
the scripts/ folder where your Flow root is a special folder, and is assumed to have pre- post-flow hooks
so currently it’s working as expected, you’ve registered a scripts/ folder that doesn’t have viable code because you haven’t configured the marketplace package it seems
I see, yeah when I only have one doc type I always setup my project such that everything is in one dir, less unnecessary nesting that way
gotcha. Ya that scripts/ folder is a special location now because of post- pre-flow hooks
I see - any reason this is not configurable?

We don’t have a UI to configure it. @Eric Han if you could help track this feature, we can note that adding the pre- post-flow UI configuration (and save it to an ibflow) would satisfy Aaron’s request
we could make this part of a recipe book for setting up a flow
